timeline.message: for#2010, support connectionInitSqls config for druid

timeline.bodyText:
Here is an integration test.
I suggestion:

if do this way, it's neccesary to use HikariDataSource instead of BasicDatasource.
creat a table in h2 db, and set an insert sql to initSql, then check it work well by a select and compare.

Or another approach:
just mock a jdbc driver behind HikariDataSource, check hikariDataSource send the initSql to mock jdbc connection/statement.
timeline.author: kimmking

replies.bodyText: connectionInitSqls in HikariDataSource is a String type, but we want to verify a collection type for this issue. also I found that collection type property not existed in in HikariDataSource, it seems that DBCP2 is ok for that
